VNS_desc: This strategy appeals to people's sensations (e.g., vision, hearing) to stimulate negative emotions intuitively.
This strategy is about linking readers with realistic things behind the data, such as the real scenes of something happening and real characters.
This strategy elicits negative emotions by using punchy communication skills to inform readers something bad.
This strategy triggers negative emotions by removing people's ability to control the things happening during their reading process.
This strategy poses people at an uncertain status for a relatively long time and thus triggers negative emotions.
This strategy elicits negative emotions by deliberately setting a task for readers and enticing them to fail.
